unit_learning_outcomes.description: communicate theorised, contextualised and informed accounts of key issues and problems in the context of countercultural practices.
analyse hierarchies of value that classify, judge and position cultural objects and practices.
evaluate those practices of everyday life that are often dismissed as worthless or ephemeral.
employ cultural literacy skills to analyse cultural difference and ethical relations across diverse social and political contexts.

assessments.description: Students are required to write a final essay in response to questions available in iLearn. Refer to iLearn for further information.
Students will build on their understanding of the key concepts to perform a visual analysis. Refer to iLearn for further information.
Students will create a short online video on selected course concepts. They will submit their video and transcript for assessment. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: MMCC2023 - Visual Countercultures: Graffiti, Kitsch and Conceptual Art

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit introduces students to a range of frameworks that question traditional hierarchies of value and that enable a critical re-evaluation of the practices of everyday life. This unit explores key topics such as: countercultures; oppositional cultures and sites of protest; the politics of high versus popular and low culture; and counter-cultural practices in global and local contexts.
data.search_title: MMCC2023 - Visual Countercultures: Graffiti, Kitsch and Conceptual Art
